member.name: P:Arction.WPF.SignalTools.UpDown.Text
member.summary: Gets or sets text of this object. Text property has priority over Content property. I.e. if you set both, only Text property's value is displayed in the text field.

member.name: P:Arction.WPF.SignalTools.GUI.SignalGenerator.SelectedPage
member.summary: Gets or sets selected page in UI.

member.name: P:Arction.WPF.SignalTools.GUI.SignalGenerator.SelectedPageIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets selected page index in UI.

member.name: T:Arction.WPF.SignalTools.AmplitudeSineSweepComponent
member.summary: Sine amplitude sweep waveform component. Runs with constant frequency, from amplitude to another, during given duration. Then jumps to start starting amplitude again.

member.name: M:Arction.WPF.SignalTools.AmplitudeSineSweepComponent.IsModified
member.summary: Returns true if any of this instances public properties have been modified. Resets flag before returning.

member.name: P:Arction.WPF.SignalTools.AmplitudeSineSweepComponent.Id
member.summary: Gets or sets the unique identifier of this instance.

member.name: P:Arction.WPF.SignalTools.AmplitudeSineSweepComponent.DurationMs
member.summary: Duration of sine sweep in ms. Runs from starting amplitude to end amplitude during this duration.

member.name: P:Arction.WPF.SignalTools.AmplitudeSineSweepComponent.Frequency
member.remarks: This is not sampling frequency of the generator!

member.name: P:Arction.WPF.SignalTools.AmplitudeSineSweepComponent.Enabled
member.summary: Is the sweep component included in calculation of the output signal

member.name: P:Arction.WPF.SignalTools.SignalReader.FileFilterString
member.summary: Filter string for file open dialog.

member.name: P:Arction.WPF.SignalTools.SignalReader.Factor
member.summary: General factor for output signal. Allows using for example millivolt range by setting this 0.001, or 1E-3. This is a dependency propety.

member.name: P:Arction.WPF.SignalTools.SignalReader.FileName
member.summary: Gets/sets the name (full path) of the data file. This is a dependency property.

member.name: P:Arction.WPF.SignalTools.SignalReader.Caption
member.summary: Gets/sets optional caption for signal reader. This is a dependency property.

member.name: P:Arction.WPF.SignalTools.SignalReader.IsLooping
member.summary: Get/sets whether reading should continue from the beginning of the data file after end-of-file has been reached. Possible file header is skipped. This is a dependency property.

member.name: P:Arction.WPF.SignalTools.SignalReader.ThreadType
member.summary: Gets/sets the way how data is generated. Generates data either using a thread or a main UI thread synchronized timer.

member.name: P:Arction.WPF.SignalTools.SignalReader.ThreadInvoking
member.summary: Gets/sets whether signal reader automatically synchronizes its event to the main UI thread. If ThreadType is ThreadType.Timer then setting ThreadInvoking has no effect.

member.name: P:Arction.WPF.SignalTools.SignalReader.IsReaderEnabled
member.summary: Get/sets whether this instance is running or not. This is a dependency property.

member.name: P:Arction.WPF.SignalTools.SignalReader.OutputInterval
member.summary: Output interval in milliseconds. This is only the target value and not always accurate. This is a dependency property.

member.name: P:Arction.WPF.SignalTools.SignalReader.SamplingFrequency
member.summary: Gets sampling frequency. The count of output points calculated per second.

member.name: P:Arction.WPF.SignalTools.SignalReader.Length
member.summary: Gets the length of the source file in samples (for each channel). For some file formats, this is an estimate.

member.name: P:Arction.WPF.SignalTools.SignalReader.FileSize
member.summary: Gets the size of the source file in bytes.

member.name: P:Arction.WPF.SignalTools.SignalReader.BitsPerSample
member.summary: Gets how many bits are for one sample.

member.name: P:Arction.WPF.SignalTools.SignalReader.LicenseKey
member.summary: License key in normal or encrypted format. This is a dependency property.

member.name: F:Arction.WPF.SignalTools.SignalReader.OpenResult.UnknownExtension
member.summary: The extension is not one of the supported ones.

member.name: F:Arction.WPF.SignalTools.SignalReader.OpenResult.UnknownWaveFormat
member.summary: WAV audio format must be PCM. Others will fail.

member.name: M:Arction.WPF.SignalTools.RandomNoiseComponent.GetRandomValue
member.summary: Get random value, using offset and amplitude

member.name: M:Arction.WPF.SignalTools.RandomNoiseComponent.IsModified
member.summary: Returns true if any of this instances public properties have been modified. Resets flag before returning.

member.name: P:Arction.WPF.SignalTools.RandomNoiseComponent.Id
member.summary: Gets or sets the unique identifier of this instance.

member.name: P:Arction.WPF.SignalTools.RandomNoiseComponent.Enabled
member.summary: Is the random noise component included in calculation of the output signal

member.name: M:Arction.WPF.SignalTools.Filtering.FilterRoutines.MovingAverage(System.Double[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Moving (floating) average. Smoothens the given data, by calculating using value and neighbor values
member.param: Averaging window length. Calculates output as average of each value and neighbours in range -windowLength/2...+windowLength/2

member.summary: Default constructor. Creates and initializes a new instance of AudioInput.

member.name: M:Arction.WPF.SignalTools.SignalGenerator.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor. Creates and initializes a new instance of SignalGenerator class.

members.member:
Default constructor. Creates and initializes a new instance of SignalGenerator class.
/// License key in normal or encrypted format. Needed when creating the object dynamically at runtime with 'new' keyword and there is no controls of the same type inserted on any UI designer form. If you provide your license this way, YOU ARE NOT ALLOWED TO DISTRIBUTE YOUR SOURCE CODE TO OTHERS. See License Agreement (EULA) for details.

member.name: P:Arction.WPF.SignalTools.SignalGenerator.LicenseKey
member.summary: License key in normal or encrypted format. This is a dependency property.

member.name: P:Arction.WPF.SignalTools.SignalGenerator.ThreadType
member.summary: Gets or sets the way how data is generated. Generates data either by using a thread or a main UI thread synchronized timer.

member.name: P:Arction.WPF.SignalTools.SignalGenerator.WaveformSines
member.summary: Get or sets sine waveform component collection. This is a dependency property.

member.name: P:Arction.WPF.SignalTools.SignalGenerator.WaveformSquares
member.summary: Get or sets square waveform component collection. This is a dependency property.

member.name: P:Arction.WPF.SignalTools.SignalGenerator.WaveformTriangles
member.summary: Get or sets triangle waveform component collection. This is a dependency property.

member.name: P:Arction.WPF.SignalTools.SignalGenerator.WaveformRandomNoises
member.summary: Get or sets random noise waveform component collection. This is a dependency property.

member.name: P:Arction.WPF.SignalTools.SignalGenerator.WaveformAmplitudeSweepSines
member.summary: Get or sets sine sweep amplitude component collection. This is a dependency property.

member.name: P:Arction.WPF.SignalTools.SignalGenerator.WaveformFrequencySweepSines
member.summary: Get or sets sine sweep amplitude component collection. This is a dependency property.

member.name: P:Arction.WPF.SignalTools.SignalGenerator.Factor
member.summary: Get or sets a general factor for output signal. Allows using e.g. millivolt range by setting this 0.001, or 1E-3. This is a dependency property.

member.name: P:Arction.WPF.SignalTools.SignalGenerator.IsGeneratorEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets the state of this generator (enabled or not). This is a dependency property.

member.name: P:Arction.WPF.SignalTools.SignalGenerator.SamplingFrequency
member.summary: Gets or sets the sampling frequency, i.e. the number of output points generated per second. This is a dependency property.

member.name: P:Arction.WPF.SignalTools.SignalGenerator.OutputInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets the output interval of this generator in milliseconds. This is a dependency property.

member.name: P:Arction.WPF.SignalTools.SignalGenerator.GeneratorName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of this signal generator. This is a dependency property.

member.name: P:Arction.WPF.SignalTools.SignalGenerator.MultiCoreProcessing
member.summary: Gets or sets whether multi-core processing is enabled. If enabled, computes the signal in multiple threads. Enables faster rendering when CPU has more cores than 1. Only certain parts of chart are multicore optimized. This is a dependency property.
member.remarks: When running the application from Visual Studio debugger, and this is enabled, the performance is worse than without multicore processing. When the application is run directly from Windows, the performance is superb.

member.name: P:Arction.WPF.SignalTools.SignalGenerator.MasterGenerator
member.summary: Master generator. Several generators can be combined together to produce a synchronized multi-channel output data stream. Master sets the sampling frequency for each slave generator and combines the samples from each slave to master's output data stream. Set this null if this is a master generator.

member.name: P:Arction.WPF.SignalTools.SignalGenerator.ThreadInvoking
member.summary: Built-in invoking to UI thread when using ThreadType = Thread.

member.name: M:Arction.WPF.SignalTools.GUI.AudioInput.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor. Creates and initializes a new instance of AudioInput class.

member.name: P:Arction.WPF.SignalTools.GUI.AudioInput.Input
member.summary: Gets or sets AudioInput component that this GUI component controls.

member.name: M:Arction.WPF.SignalTools.SpectrumCalculator.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructor with license key, in normal or encrypted format.

member.name: M:Arction.WPF.SignalTools.SpectrumCalculator.PowerSpectrumOverlapped(System.Double[],System.Int32,System.Double,System.Double[]@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Calculates power spectrum, having all FFT data in absolute values. Overlaps moving FFT window until all data is processed. The count of output FFT data is same than input data.
member.param: Overlapping percent. Moving FFT window is shifted by this amount for next calculation round. Valid values are 0...99
Output FFT data. Length equals fftWindowLenght. If samples length is less than fftWindowLength, outputs samples length of data.
Processed sample count. It is possible that all samples are not processed from the end, if there's not enough data for last FFT window.

member.name: M:Arction.WPF.SignalTools.SpectrumCalculator.PowerSpectrumOverlapped(System.Single[],System.Int32,System.Double,System.Single[]@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Calculates power spectrum, having all FFT data in absolute values. Overlaps moving FFT window until all data is processed. The count of output FFT data is same than input data.
member.param: Overlapping percent. Moving FFT window is shifted by this amount for next calculation round. Valid values are 0...99
Output FFT data. Length equals fftWindowLenght. If samples length is less than fftWindowLength, outputs samples length of data.
Processed sample count. It is possible that all samples are not processed from the end, if there's not enough data for last FFT window.

member.name: M:Arction.WPF.SignalTools.SpectrumCalculator.CalculateForward(System.Double[],System.Double[]@)
member.summary: Calculates FFT conversion. Converts signal data into frequency component data.

member.name: M:Arction.WPF.SignalTools.SpectrumCalculator.CalculateForward(System.Single[],System.Single[]@)
member.summary: Calculates FFT conversion. Converts signal data into frequency component data.

member.name: M:Arction.WPF.SignalTools.SpectrumCalculator.CalculateBackward(System.Double[],System.Double[]@)
member.summary: Calculates backwards FFT conversion. Converts frequency component data into signal sample data.

member.name: M:Arction.WPF.SignalTools.SpectrumCalculator.CalculateBackward(System.Single[],System.Single[]@)
member.summary: Calculates backwards FFT conversion. Converts frequency component data into signal sample data.

member.name: M:Arction.WPF.SignalTools.SpectrumCalculator.PowerSpectrum(System.Double[],System.Double[]@)
member.summary: Calculates power spectrum, having all FFT data in absolute values. The count of output FFT data is same than input data.

member.name: M:Arction.WPF.SignalTools.SpectrumCalculator.PowerSpectrum(System.Single[],System.Single[]@)
member.summary: Calculates power spectrum, having all FFT data in absolute values.

member.summary: License key in normal or encrypted format. This is a dependency property.

member.name: P:Arction.WPF.SignalTools.SquareComponent.Symmetry
member.summary: Square wave symmetry. Valid range is 0...1. If symmetry is < 0.5, the 'low'stage of noise wave is longer than 'high' stage. Vice versa, value > 0.5 makes the 'high' stage longer

member.name: M:Arction.WPF.SignalTools.AudioOutput.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor. Creates and initializes a new instance of AudioOutput class.

member.name: M:Arction.WPF.SignalTools.AudioOutput.AddSamples(System.Double[][])
member.summary: Use this method to feed new data to audio output stream.
member.param: Samples to be fed to audio output stream ([Channel][Sample]).

member.name: M:Arction.WPF.SignalTools.AudioOutput.Start
member.summary: Starts this instance. Is equivalent to setting IsOutputEnabled property true.

member.name: M:Arction.WPF.SignalTools.AudioOutput.StopRequest
member.summary: Signals this instance to stop. Stopping does not occur immediately after exiting this method. By subscribing to Stopped event, caller is notified when everything has stopped. Is equivalent to setting IsOutputEnabled property true.

member.name: E:Arction.WPF.SignalTools.AudioOutput.Started
member.summary: Occurs when audio playback has been started.

member.name: E:Arction.WPF.SignalTools.AudioOutput.Stopped
member.summary: Occurs when audio playback has been stopped.

member.name: P:Arction.WPF.SignalTools.AudioOutput.Balance
member.summary: Gets or sets audio playback balance. Valid values are between -100 to 100. -100 means that audio is played only through the left speaker. 0 means that both speakers output audio. 100 means that audio is played only through the right speaker. This is a dependency property.

member.name: P:Arction.WPF.SignalTools.AudioOutput.BitsPerSample
member.summary: Gets or sets how many bits are allocated per sample. Supported values are 8 and 16. If other value is used, 16 is used instead. Is settable when IsInputEnabled is false. This is a dependency property.

member.name: P:Arction.WPF.SignalTools.AudioOutput.IsOutputEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets the state of this instance (i.e. starts or stops it). Setting this property true is the same as calling Start method where false is the same as calling Stop method. This is a dependency property.

member.name: P:Arction.WPF.SignalTools.AudioOutput.IsStereo
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to use two channels (stereo) or just one (mono). Is settable when IsInputEnabled is false. This is a dependency property.

member.name: P:Arction.WPF.SignalTools.AudioOutput.LicenseKey
member.summary: License key string in normal or encrypted format. This is a dependency property.

member.name: P:Arction.WPF.SignalTools.AudioOutput.PlaybackDevice
member.summary: Gets or sets the current playback device. Is settable when IsInputEnabled is false. By setting this property null, Windows' default playback device is used. This is a dependency property.

member.name: P:Arction.WPF.SignalTools.AudioOutput.SamplesPerSecond
member.summary: Gets or sets sampling frequency. Is settable when IsInputEnabled is false. This is a dependency property.

member.name: P:Arction.WPF.SignalTools.AudioOutput.Volume
member.summary: Gets or sets volume (0-100). Is settable when IsInputEnabled is false. This is a dependency property.

member.name: M:Arction.WPF.SignalTools.AudioInput.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor. Creates and initializes a new instance of AudioInput class.

member.name: M:Arction.WPF.SignalTools.AudioInput.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructor. Creates and initializes a new instance of AudioInput class.

member.summary: Connects this AudioInput instance to a target object that has at least one of the three event handlers defined.
member.param: Target object that this AudioInput instance is connected with.
member.returns: True if connection was created succesfully. Otherwise false.

member.name: M:Arction.WPF.SignalTools.AudioInput.Disconnect(System.Object)
member.summary: Disconnects a target object from this AudioInput instance.
member.returns: True if target object was diconnected succesfully. Otherwise false.

member.summary: Starts this instance. Is equivalent to setting IsInputEnabled property true.

member.name: M:Arction.WPF.SignalTools.AudioInput.StopRequest
member.summary: Signals this instance to stop. Stopping does not occur immediately after exiting this method. By subscribing to Stopped event, caller is notified when everything has stopped. Is equivalent to setting IsInputEnabled property true.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether to use two channels (stereo) or just one (mono). Is settable when IsInputEnabled is false. This is a dependency property.

member.name: M:Arction.WPF.SignalTools.SignalReaderM.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor. Creates and initializes a new instance of SignalReaderM class.

member.name: M:Arction.WPF.SignalTools.SignalReaderM.ReadAllData(System.String,System.Int32@,System.Int32@,System.Double[][]@,Arction.WPF.SignalTools.SignalReader.Marker[]@)
member.summary: Read all data from file. The output is a multi-channel samples array, and array of markers.
member.param: Signal file name. The file extension must be a supported one: wav, sid or ssd
Multi-channel samples array. First dimension is the channels, second dimension is samples. For example, samples[2][9] gives access to 10th sample of 3rd channel.
Array of markers. Null if none was found.

member.name: E:Arction.WPF.SignalTools.SignalReaderM.Stopped
member.summary: File reader has stopped. End of file has been reached and looping is not enabled.

member.name: E:Arction.WPF.SignalTools.SignalReaderM.EndOfFile
member.summary: End of file has been reached
member.remarks: If Looping is set, this is called just before jumping to beging of the file.

member.name: P:Arction.WPF.SignalTools.SignalReaderM.FileFilterString
member.summary: Filter string for file open dialog.

member.name: P:Arction.WPF.SignalTools.SignalReaderM.SamplingFrequency
member.summary: Gets sampling frequency. The number of output points calculated per second.

member.name: P:Arction.WPF.SignalTools.SignalReaderM.Length
member.summary: Length of opened file, in samples (for each channel). For some file formats, this is an estimate.

member.name: M:Arction.WPF.SignalTools.SignalGeneratorM.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor. Create and initializes a new instance of SignalGenerator class.

member.name: M:Arction.WPF.SignalTools.SignalGeneratorM.GetCoreCount
member.summary: Returns the count of enabled CPU cores.

member.name: M:Arction.WPF.SignalTools.SignalGeneratorM.RequestStop
member.summary: Stops the timer or the thread that is used in generating signal. If ThreadType is ThreadType.Thread then Stop method could exit before the thread is stopped. Subscribe to Stopped event which is triggered when signal generator is completely stopped (i.e. the timer or the thread is stopped).

member.name: M:Arction.WPF.SignalTools.SignalGeneratorM.DivideArrayForThreads(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Get multicore-processed array. Tells - how many threads are needed, - item count to process per thread - array index where the processing must start for each thread
member.param: Array length, which is to processed in multi-core
Maximum thread count to use. Give System.Environment.ProcessorCount, if no special reason to use less.
member.returns: Array process info per thread. Returned array length is the needed thread count.

member.name: M:Arction.WPF.SignalTools.SignalGeneratorM.GenerateBlock(System.Int32)
member.summary: Generates block of having given sample count, using properties set

member.summary: Occurs when signal generator is started.
